casebody.data:
Robert Melvin LOWE, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No 4795. United States Court of Appeals Tenth Circuit. March 27, 1954. James L. Tilly, Denver, Colo., for Appellant. „ , , _ John F. Raper Jr. U S. Atty., and C. N. Bloomfield, Jr., Asst. U. S. Atty., Cheyenne, Wyo., for the United States.

Before PHILLIPS, Chief Judge, and BRATTON and MURRAH, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

This is an appeal from an order deny-ing a motion to set aside a sentence under 28 U.S.C.A. § 2255. The questions presented were decided adversely to appellant’s contentions in Craig v. Hunter, 10 Cir., 167 F.2d 721. On authority of ^*at decision, the order is affirmed.
